message.content:
We first extract the key numbers at the period‐end (2024‑01‑28) from the statements.

1. Debt to Equity Ratio 
 • Liabilities: From the balance sheet, Total Current Liabilities = 1,548,001.20  
 • Owner’s Equity: Total Owner's Equity = 14,105,265.77  
 • Debt to Equity Ratio = Liabilities / Owner’s Equity = 1,548,001.20 / 14,105,265.77 ≈ 0.11

2. Net Profit Margin 
 • Net Profit: 1,105,265.77 (from the income statement)  
 • Total Revenue: 5,760,023.09 (from the income statement)  
 • Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100 = (1,105,265.77 / 5,760,023.09) × 100 ≈ 19.19%

3. Return on Assets (ROA) 
 • Total Assets: 15,653,266.97 (from the balance sheet)  
 • ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100 = (1,105,265.77 / 15,653,266.97) × 100 ≈ 7.07%

4. Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio 
 • Main Business Revenue (Sales): 5,760,023.09  
 • Accounts Receivable: The beginning AR value was 0 and the ending value is 1,454,443.80. The average AR = (0 + 1,454,443.80) / 2 = 727,221.90  
 • Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio = Sales / Average AR = 5,760,023.09 / 727,221.90 ≈ 7.92

Thus, the final answers are:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.11",
    "Net Profit Margin": "19.19%",
    "Return on Assets (ROA)": "7.07%",
    "Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio": "7.92"
  }
}
